name: The Chronicles of Nyanya
detailed_description:
Feature List

  • One-of- a-kind world: a mix of cute pixel art, adult themes and wonderful weirdness!
  • Huge, 20-hour story installed on a retro-style RPG chassis
  • First-rate humor: hilarious dialogues, memes, wordplay, pop culture references
  • Tons of demanding turn-based fights, many special abilities to use
  • The only game ever where you can fight Nazi furniture!


About the Game

On the technical side, The Chronicles of Nyanya is a retro-style RPG with pixel art graphics, turn-based battles, exciting story and 20 hours of gameplay.
...but that’s just the tip of the meowceberg!

The game’s creators used this vehicle to deliver you tons of humor, delicious weirdness and in some moments – pure craziness.

One-of-a-kind world of oddity

The world of Nyanya is full of cute kitties, living pastries and furniture enemies.
Is it fantasy? Fairy tale?
Naaah, such clichéd descriptions have no place where Nyanya’s concerned.
It’s a peculiar world much more in the style of your favorite adult TV cartoon.
It’s where bright, funny graphics meet serious issues and sarcastic humor.


Take Purrevar, one of the game’s NPC’s.
He is the subject of constant discrimination because he’s black.
And black cats – according to the popular stereotype – bring bad luck.


The game’s protagonist – meowsassin Catair, seen here in one of her darker moments, isn’t exactly a happy optimist.
You wouldn’t be either if you lost your whole family when you were a child and witnessed your neighbors being burnt alive during the massacre of your village.
As you progress through the game’s story, you can try pull Catair away from the darkness... or not.

Ubiquitous humor and references

If you feel like comedy today, don’t Netflix and chill – play Nyanya and laugh out loud!
The game is full of hilarious dialogues, meme jokes, ironic comments and fun pop culture references.


The more movies and TV series you’ve watched, novels and comic book you’ve read, or games you’ve played – the more fun you’ll have!

Long game, HUGE story

The ‘indie game’ term doesn’t have to mean ‘short storyline’.
How about a playthrough lasting 20 hours?
The Chronicles of Nyanya’s script is over 113 000 words long!
That’s more than The Hobbit (95 000 words) and only a bit less than LotR: The Return of the King (134 000 words).
Impressed?

Of course you’ll have to play multiple times to discover every plot branch and dialogue variant.
Good luck!

Meaningful choices

You can influence many aspects of The Chronicles of Nyanya’s gameplay and story, including Catair’s behavior, her relationships with key characters, and the course of the epic grand finale.
Try it for yourself!

Hit a Nazi!

Somehow those bastards have a tendency to squirm their way into our real lives and we bet you’re as angry about it as we are.
Good news: the game lets you hit them with all you’ve got!


As you can see, The Chronicles of Nyanya depicts Nazis as angry furniture, because you know, they’re not the highest forms of existence anyway.
During your encounters with them you can cut them with a sword, smash them with a war hammer or staff, humiliate them with spells, curses and special techniques, or send them a storm of flaming arrows.
You’re welcome!

Great production values

The game’s overly cute graphics, epic story and witty dialogue were created by Ilona Myszkowska, a.k.a. Snailish, a famous Polish illustrator.
The energizing and emotional soundtrack is the work of Marcin Maślanka, an experienced composer of game and movie music.
Quality!

short_description: A sweet jRPG-style game about cats, brutal massacres, cuteness, racism and social issues, friendship, sinister thoughts, hilarity and Nazi furniture. It’s an epic attempt to blow your mind with adult themes hidden behind bright cartoon graphics.
reviews:
“Triple-A developers should take note: This one has it all.”
8.5/10 – Game Space

“... looking and feeling like an AAA title than ingenious indie relaese...”
9/10 – Bonus Stage

“... one of the most refreshing and fun RPGs that I have played in a long, long time.”
80/100 – Gaming Trend
